metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2283 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability was found in libssh, where the authentication check of the connecting client can be bypassed in the`pki_verify_data_signature` function in memory allocation problems. This issue may happen if there is insufficient memory or the memory usage is limited. The problem is caused by the return value `rc,` which is initialized to SSH_ERROR and later rewritten to save the return value of the function call `pki_key_check_hash_compatible.` The value of the variable is not changed between this point and the cryptographic verification. Therefore any error between them calls `goto error` returning SSH_OK.

criterions.comment: libssh: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
